10 May 2011 #broadworks #sbc #sip

Just over 2 months ago I started a massive project to upgrade Broadworks from Release 13 to Release 14.SP8. R13/R14 requires RHEL4 and there is an issue I ran into when running the up2date process on my dev system.

Broadsoft Cluster Nodes "Out of Sync"

10 May 2011 #broadworks #sbc #sip

I am in the process of fixing two cluster installations which were originally performed by a third party consulting group. The peerctl lists were not setup correctly and thus replication is not working from the primary node to the secondary node on either platform.

Testing SIP Header Manipulation Rules from the Acme Packet (ACLI) Command Line

09 May 2011 #acme packet #sbc #sip

SIP Header Manipulation provides the flexibility to add, remove, or modify any attribute in a SIP message on the Acme Packet SBC. The most common reason for doing this is to fix an incompatibility problem between two SIP endpoints. This could range from anything such as Softswitch/PSTN incompatibility or an issue between two different IP PBX platforms in a multi-site Enterprise where calls between them fail due to issues in the SIP messaging.

Read more...

Acme Packet SBC and Configuring Codec Policies for SIP Call Flows

20 Feb 2011 #acme packet #sbc #sip

The Acme Packet Session Director (often referred to as a Session Border Controller) has the flexibility of re-ordering or completely removing certain codecs from SDP (Session Description Protocol) before passing a SIP Invite to the destination SIP endpoint.

Read more...

Adjusting Cisco IOS SIP invite timers and retry values for sip-ua

09 Feb 2011 #cisco #cube

Cisco IOS contains a configurable object called sip-ua or SIP User Agent where several SIP settings may be altered from their default behavior. The focus here are the settings for SIP Retry Invite and SIP Timers and why it makes sense to change the default settings on the router if calls should reroute to another path if the primary SIP Trunk is unavailable.

Read more...
